etymologies: Middle English (in splint (sense 2 of the noun); also denoting a section of armour): from Middle Dutch, Middle Low German splinte ‘metal plate or pin’; related to splinter

definitions: a strip of rigid material used for supporting and immobilizing a broken bone when it has been set

examples.text: she had to wear splints on her legs

shortDefinitions: strip of rigid material used for supporting and immobilizing broken bone

definitions: a long, thin strip of wood used to light a fire.
shortDefinitions: long, thin strip of wood used to light fire

definitions: a rigid or flexible strip, especially of wood, used in basketwork.
shortDefinitions: rigid or flexible strip used in basketwork

definitions: a bony enlargement on the inside of a horse's leg, on the splint bone.
shortDefinitions: bony enlargement on inside of horse's leg

definitions: secure (a broken limb) with a splint or splints
shortDefinitions: secure broken limb with splint or splints
